It seems that you\'re running a Mad Stinky build, that means that you\'re using a totally experimental build, and obviously bugs and issues are expected. If the bugs you\'re facing aren\'t listed on our post about this kind of builds, please report it to our Telegram group or, in case that\'s a device-related issue, report it who did the build.

Be patient for the logs to be created
Action failed because of missing superuser access

Maybe you're here and wondering "What the hell is all this and what i have to send?"
Well, here's some info about the stuff you can send:

Logcat: It's the way that Android outputs all system events, like errors, crashes, or even info about a process being run. Ideal for crashes and FCs.

Dmesg: It outputs some of the kernel messages, but filtering stuff that users may not care… if they do care

Kmesg: It's the same as Dmesg but without the filters, giving more info about all the kernel events. Ideal for random reboots.

, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.

Smart Pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see a significant improvement in battery life. For a good user experience, we recommend setting the amount of disabled pixels to 75 percent while shifting every 10 minutes.
